Fields.DialogueText: Hah! Right into my hands, harlot! Attack!
Damn it all, where is Akagi? She vanished right after the battle.

Fields.MenuText: I'm terribly sorry, but could you repeat that?
You're going to have to wake up earlier to pull something like that on me, sailor.
Ah, I see. Do the pistols and rifles have the next slot, or is it the pilots after?

Fields.DialogueText: She's, ah... she's reading to her aircraft, Kanchou.
It's the truth, Kanchou! Really. See for yourself in the main hangar.
I believe it's the pilots next, Kanchou, in the main briefing room
What does one read to planes, anyway?
@BATTLE
You there. Where is Akagi?
Kanchou! Akagi-sama is in the hangar. This is her usual time to read to the planes.
Today is the Bansenshūkai, I believe.
Isn't that an ancient text on ninjutsu?
Yes, Kanchou. She likes that one a lot. The Shōninki and Ninpiden are also favorites of hers.
Hmm. Curious. All right, dismissed.
Well, it's not the weirdest thing I've heard of a Belle doing. Guess I'll have to investigate and see what she's up to.
Oh, Kanchou! Good timing - we just finished today's training. You all are dismissed.
Akagi, they're planes. They're not going anywhere.
Not going anywhere yet. They have their orders, and as the instruments of my will they shall carry them out.
Don't you mean the pilots' will?
Them too. By the way, Kanchou, I want you to issue orders to engineering to cut power to one screw.
That'll limit our speed quite a bit.
That's the idea.

Fields.MenuText: What are you scheming?
I can't hazard my ship - you - on a whim.
... Akagi, are you plotting what I think you're plotting?

Fields.DialogueText: Telling would ruin the surprise.
You can when it's entirely planned out and the ship herself requests it.
Perhaps. You'll just have to let me go ahead with it and find out, won't you?
Oh, this will be fun, Kanchou. Come, let's you and I have a drink. A little sake to properly prepare us for the meal to come.
*ALARM*
Seems like the sakizuki has appeared early. Let's not be late to the meal, Kanchou.
@BATTLE
Ah, Akagi, there you are. I--
Excellent timing, Kanchou. Care for some ocha? Or perhaps something stronger?
I, uh... I suppose I'll have some tea.
Hai, Kanchou, dozo.
... Where the hell did she come from?
I live in the shadows, Kanchou, at Kami-sama's will. As she serves you, I serve you as well.
That will be all, Osono-chan.
Shitsureishimasu.
I swear my life gets stranger every day.
That means the gods have blessed you with an interesting life, Kanchou.
I think I'm starting to understand why the Chinese refer to that blessing as a curse. So what are you doing?
Watching. Look there, to port. Do you see it?

Fields.MenuText: I don't see anything, Akagi.
I see the sailors have been slacking on keeping your flight deck properly cleaned.
Hmm... smoke. Incoming ships?

Fields.DialogueText: We'll have to work on your perception, Kanchou. There's much to see in almost every situation.
Also a problem - one I'll have Osono-chan rectify - but not what I'm looking at.
More specifically, a Morgana task group.
They are a small vanguard force of Morgana scouts. I've ordered some spare parts; mostly damaged things, cast overboard.
I also have some fuel being burned in such a way to make the smoke from my stacks more intense.
They shall get overly enthusiastic and attack... now.
*GUNFIRE*
*ALARM*
Surprisingly good shot for Murder. She's normally a bit too bloodthirsty to be accurate.
Now do finish your tea and let's stroll over to the bridge, Kanchou. We should arrive just in time to thrash this filth.
@BATTLE
Bring us about. Launch all aircraft.
Kiru! Strike, my servants! Strike!
So let me get this straight. You're luring in a Morgana heavy cruiser?
Malice, specifically. She's frightfully dim even by Funayūrei standards.
She's compelled to do harm in any possible situation, and is therefore easy to lure. She's a good candidate for engaging with British-style Q-ships.
However, since my spies located her, I figured I'd have some fun with her personally.

Fields.MenuText: A good plan, if a bit overkill for a single heavy cruiser.
I'd like it if you informed me about your plans next time.
Wait, you have spies now?

Fields.DialogueText: If it was just Malice I'd agree, but they always run in packs, nasty little creatures that they are.
It's more fun... "keeping my cards close to the vest," as the Yankees say, Kanchou. Worry not. You'll always be informed precisely when you need to be.
Of course, Kanchou. My planes are my beloved retainers, and such faithful servants they are.
That's who's been sending these small scouting squadrons against us recently, by the by.
Malice is feeling us out, eh?
And trying to pin down our location to mass against us. We'll foil her easily enough.
@BATTLE
Ah, the tea is excellent today. Osono-chan, a mug for Kanchou, if you please.
What the devil? Where did you... how does she keep doing that?
Hai, Kami-sama! Kanchou-sama, dozo.
She's a credit to her art, is she not?
She seems to be able to go through locked doors without opening them, too.
She's almost as mysterious as the fox the crew keep talking about.
Oh? A fox?
Apparently there's a fox that likes to wander around the ship.
Fufufu. One wonders wherever such a creature could have come from.
I suspect Belle involvement.
That sounds very accusatory, Kanchou.

Fields.MenuText: That's because it is.
Oh no, not at all, Akagi.
You'll be interested to know that the pool is split on whether or not you are the fox.

Fields.DialogueText: It seems you're getting sharper every day, Kanchou.
Sarcasm is unbecoming of you, Kanchou.
Moi? A vixen? Flattering, but simply not true!
Ah, there's our next guest. Shall we adjourn to the bridge, Kanchou?
You're too damn relaxed about this whole business.
You should relax more, Kanchou, and keep an ear out for my intelligence reports. This is all according to plan.
@BATTLE
Gah! Where did... Wait. Where the hell did you go!?
We need to talk about that servant of yours, Osono.
Kanchou-sama, Akagi-sama requests your presence at once.
Ah, there you are, Kanchou.
Has she offered some offense? Or have you perhaps fallen in love with her?
I just want to know how the hell she got through a locked door without making a noise!
Ara, is it not a ninja's job to be where they aren't expected?
Apparently her job is to give me a heart attack!
Anyway, put a bell on her uniform or something.
Fufufu. Osono has all the stealth of a cat then, eh? She'll be pleased at the compliment.
Now then... see here, Kanchou.
That's quite the plume of smoke on the horizon.
The bait has been laid. A few of our other ships are acting as if they've been lamed, Malice is springing her trap.

Fields.MenuText: Sounds like she's dancing to your tune.
Artfully done, Akagi.
I take it part of the air group is already flying?

Fields.DialogueText: Inelegantly, but yes. There will be time for dance lessons for her in Hell, I'm sure.
Arigato gozaimasu, Kanchou. I shall endeavor to make yet more art for you to enjoy.
Why, yes. I just happened to launch a larger-than-normal patrol at the watch change. Consisting of torpedo and dive bombers.
Now at last we enter the next stage of our performance. Transmit to all planes! Senbai!
Battle stations! Bring us about to engage!
@BATTLE
Fufufu. Yes. Everything according to plan.
Careful where you're swinging that fan around.
I'll try not to fan your flames too much, Kanchou. Please, join me.
So what are you chuckling to yourself about?
Seems we've got the attention of the Navy Ministry. We'll be receiving an envoy.
Why wasn't I informed about this?
I'm informing you now, Kanchou. The arrangements have already been made.

Fields.MenuText: You're up to something.
I wish they could send us something more useful than a random government flunky.
Do you need me to play any specific part in your little game this time?

Fields.DialogueText: Always, Kanchou.
Koku-san is far from random, I assure you.
Just be yourself, Kanchou. As always, that will be more than enough.
Uh-huh. One day I'll know what's going on around here.
I should hope not! If you lay all my secrets bare I might get boring, and there's nothing more tragic than being boring.
Speaking of boredom, the entertainment is about to arrive.
I don't suppose you mean anything...
*ALARM*
... good.
For the record, an enemy flotilla doesn't generally count as entertainment.
Oh, but it does, Kanchou. Allow me to demonstrate!
@BATTLE
Fly, my darlings! Crush them all!
@BATTLE
Our guest should be arriving soon, Kanchou.
How's he getting here?
Motor launch from a Japanese ship - unawakened, of course. Can't have a Belle conducting government business.
What government business would bring him aboard an aircraft carrier?
That is the question, isn't it?

Fields.MenuText: I want to ask, but I'm pretty sure you won't tell me even if I do.
Sounds more and more suspect the more I think about it.
Whatever's happening, keep it contained. You hear me?

Fields.DialogueText: Now you're just being no fun.
Then you're paying proper attention.
That is the idea, Kanchou, trust me. Everything is perfectly under control.
Ah. Here he is.
Hajimemashte Koku-san. I am Akagi, the kami of this vessel, and this is my captain. We are honored to have you join us.
Yes. I serve the Imperial will, and I am bidden to inspect this ship, its crew, and the fleet.
You have every right, of course. Let's get you situated, shall we?
Osono, if you would be so kind as to show Koku-san to his quarters?
Hai, Kami-sama. This way please, minister.
... It was just a greeting, but that guy seems slimy.
A most astute observation.
I take it you know something?
I suspect something. It remains to be seen if I am right. Come, let's see to our guest. I won't have our hospitality be in question.
There you are, Akagi. Where's Koku? I figured he'd be haunting your footsteps.
Quite the opposite, Kanchou. He's avoiding me, which means my suspicions are likely correct.
Well, don't keep me in suspense.
It will be more fun if you guess. Assuming something's wrong about Koku, what do you suspect it is?

Fields.MenuText: He's a bureaucrat at best and a politician at worst. How he *isn't* crooked would be a shorter list.
He's clearly been brainwashed by the Morganas.
He's a spy - but whose spy?

Fields.DialogueText: True, but not quite where I'm going with this line of inquiry.
He does have something of a dull, lifeless quality to him, doesn't he? But, no, I don't think so.
Bravo! Full marks, Kanchou! And the appropriate follow-on question as well.
Koku is a spy, I'm certain of it. Whose spy - and his objectives - are more questionable...
I'm not clear on what a spy would hope to gain from us, anyway. It's not like we're sitting on a secret trove of False Hope's diaries.
Oh, Kanchou, you're too pure for this world sometimes. Or perhaps too focused on your war.
Your zeal and devotion to your mission does you credit.
However, you sit like a Western dragon on the greatest horde of naval intelligence ever gathered.
How many elite units of the world's navies are now in INPF service? And your service specifically?
Honestly, there are spies in the fleet solely to keep tabs on you - because if you had the will, you could alter the war.

Fields.MenuText: But I wouldn't... At least I don't think I would.
Which is why I've been at pains to be transparent in the first place.
Great. Something new to lose sleep over.

Fields.DialogueText: And that does you honor, but nations cannot rely on assumption. Especially when they place their secrets in your hands.
And that does you honor, but nations cannot rely on your good intentions. Especially when they place their secrets in your hands.
You know it's true, though. Nations cannot rely on assumption. Especially when they place their secrets in your hands.
His Imperial Majesty has bequeathed unto you his finest weapons of war, that the Funayūrei might be destroyed with all prejudice.
There is great weight upon you for that, I...
*ALARM*
Chikuso! I let myself be distracted.
Battle stations!
@BATTLE
Where did Akagi get off to? She missed the staff meeting.
Oh, there she is. What's she doing?
Must be stalking Koku. Good thing she doesn't have a tail like some belles. It'd be waving like a predator on the hunt for sure.
I'll just slide up here and...
Shhhh. Stay low. Look there. Koku is meeting with someone. A regular sailor.
Bit low ranked for Koku to associate with.
They took great pains to avoid being followed, but their measures are ineffective against me within my own hull.
Koku slipped up and underestimated me. Now I can search the belongings of that sailor.
Not Koku's?
He'll be prepared for that, I... damn, he's coming this way!
You vanishing won't help me. Damn, I could really use a distraction right about...
*ALARM*
That works!
@BATTLE
Think we tricked them?
Perfectly. I took a sailor's form and ran away in the opposite direction. They were far more focused on me than on you heading for the bridge.

Fields.MenuText: I'm probably already on their watch list anyway.
Seems the game is afoot.
I want this nonsense off my damn ship.

Fields.DialogueText: Likely. Any Belle captain is likely on every intelligence service on earth's watch list - and you more than most.
Yes, indeed. Oh, this will be ever so much fun!
As your damn ship, I vehemently agree - even if I do appreciate the entertainment.
Come join me for tea soon, Kanchou. By the time you do, I might have some information.
Some of those reports you were asking for, Kanchou... and some interesting things for kami-sama. About... the sensitive matter.
I see. Thank you, carry on.
Hai!
I think I have Koku slightly worn out. I dragged him through half the ship as part of his inspection tour.
Any hints as to what he’s up to?
Nothing obvious, but then I’m playing the wise kami, which makes active intelligence gathering difficult. What about you?
Well, there’s a couple of department reports. Some sailors have been moving about at odd hours... nothing worth tossing them in the brig over, but enough to be noticed.
Next we have some interesting coded transmissions going off ship. Some of them slightly resemble Japanese codes, but...
Obviously we don’t have code books for anything like that. Yes, I see. What on earth do you think is happening, Kanchou?

Fields.MenuText: I couldn’t begin to guess. We need more information.
Some type of organized smuggling ring, perhaps?
Some sort of reverse infiltration?

Fields.DialogueText: Yes... more information...
That seems plausible, but who? And smuggling what?
Reverse... that’s... hmm. You might be onto something, Kanchou.
I need to go track down a lead.
*ALARM*
...Right after we handle that. Osono! Monitor our guest! Quickly!
Ryoukai Kami-sama.
@BATTLE
Kanchou, please, step into your office. I’ve been borrowing it.
I notice you’ve made yourself at home.
I know where everything is, honest. Now, I’ve managed to track some things down.
The codes we’ve been intercepting aren’t naval codes. They’re army, and they’re outdated - several years old.
It makes me wonder if the transmissions aren’t some sort of red herring.
You’ve got some suspicions about what our guest is up to, then?
I'm most worried he's Kempeitai, the Japanese secret police. If they’re trying to make moves to foment nationalist sentiment in the INPF fleet, or apply their commissar powers...

Fields.MenuText: Hell’s bells, that’s an international incident just waiting to happen!
Yeah, I've been waiting for something like that. Dammit.
From their point of view, I can see it making sense.

Fields.DialogueText: I have no doubt many in the Army and Navy would want the kami to do what these officers would see as their full duty to the Emperor and the nation.
That, however, is not our purpose... even if I suspect some kami might be willing to indulge them.

Fields.MenuText: Care to name names? We might need to take action and dry dock those ships.
Not you, of course.
Damn them, can’t they see the real enemy?

Fields.DialogueText: I don’t have a solid list... and I don’t suspect it’s the plot at hand just yet.
Of course not. My loyalty is to you, and to the Emperor. His Majesty has bid us to strike down the Funayūrei to defend the islands of Japan, and all mankind.
Greed - for money, for power - have long blinded mankind in times of great peril.
I have sent out a few requests to see if any members of the various intelligence communities can help us break the codes we’re hearing.
Wouldn’t my signature be needed on that sort of request?
You... ah... you signed them.
Akagi...
*ALARM*
For once the cursed hags have decent timing.
If you think a battle’s getting you out of this you have another think coming!
@BATTLE
All planes! Launch! Sei bai!!
@BATTLE
So. You going to come clean?
Fine. Hold on, let me clean a bit of deck so I can perform dogeza properly.
Kanchou, in my zeal to complete the mission, I forged your signature on a few requests to INPF intelligence. Moushiwake arimasen.
Get up, Akagi - there’s no need to be dramatic about this.
I just want to know why you didn’t simply ask. I’d have approved it immediately.
Compartmentalization. Not even Osono knows that I sent off for this assistance. I am “playing things close to the vest.”
Let’s avoid committing crimes in the name of security in the future, shall we? We can trust each other, if no one else.
Oh, most of the crew is loyal. They just gossip like old women.

Fields.MenuText: So, did we actually learn anything?
I wonder if the transmissions have any content that actually matters.
Maybe we’re overcomplicating things...

Fields.DialogueText: Yes, we got some decoding information. Osono’s working on it now.
Only one way to find out.
Possibly, but if we can get more information we can bait a trap for our tiger.
We’ll get these bastards, Kanchou. I swear it.
I never doubted you on that score. I just want to know what the hell we’re about to catch.
We’ll just have to see - but I’m not letting these fools operate in my hull even if they’re just a very private charity outreach group.
Kanchou! Join me please. I was just about to have some tea, and perhaps smoke my kiseru.
I've learned to never say no to tea.
One wonders who has had the most influence on you in that regard. Hopefully not the British. Black tea is so dreary.
Osono! Play a song for us, would you?
Hai Kami-sama, kanchou-sama.
I didn't know Osono played the shamisen.
I actually taught her to play. There, now we look like properly at ease nobility...
I take it you found something and wanted to make sure we weren't overheard?
You're getting good at this sort of thing, Kanchou! Yes, that's exactly it.
I had Koku-san tailed on our last port call. He left with a briefcase and came back with nothing.
I also had some luck finding out who exactly he is. He's not with the Kaigun-shō, for one thing.
More specifically, he's some sort of mid-level Army ministry functionary.
He's not with the Navy Ministry? Why is he performing inspections, then?
Koku-san isn't performing an official inspection. He's just using his authority as an army minister to... "bum a ride," I believe the sailor said.
Sounds like our sailor is American.
We do have men and women of all nations, after all.

Fields.MenuText: So, are we any closer to figuring this out?
We need Koku's service record, I think. To get his full background.
He's sounding more like Kempeitai every day to me.

Fields.DialogueText: A little. One step at a time, Kanchou, no need to rush.
My thoughts exactly. I've already called in a favor and sent for them.
Perhaps, this may also be more traditional interservice rivalry... or something more tawdry.
Regardless, we are most certainly on Koku's trail. I won't be outfoxed. Not by the likes of him.
*ALARM*
Damn them, just when I was actually starting to relax!
@BATTLE
At last, my diplomatic courier's pouch has arrived.
Getting privileged information from the Japanese foreign office now?
No, they're just the messengers. This is a "gift" from a friend in the Navy Ministry.
The service records of one Chuichi Koku, Rikugun Shōsa, Major, Imperial Japanese Army.
Most recently of the Kwangtung Army, where he oversaw a small jade mining operation.
Among a few other things, such as leading a battalion of infantry.

Fields.MenuText: Well, that sounds... perfectly normal, actually.
That doesn't exactly give us much.
Jade, huh? Worth a lot of money to the right people.

Fields.DialogueText: Perfectly normal for a loyal army officer, yes.
It gives us enough.
Indeed it is, Kanchou. The plot thickens.
I suspect I know what's going on.
With your permission, I'd like to have Osono search Koku-san's room, and tail him actively.
We must know what's in these little packages he seems to be handing out at every other port.
Do it. Let's...
*ALARM*
... Get to the bridge!
Right behind you, Kanchou! Already turning into the wind to launch aircraft!
@BATTLE
I see... thank you, Osono. That will be all.
Shitsureishimasu! Oh! Kanchou-sama, konnichiwa! Sumimasen.
And she's gone. I was serious about the bell for her uniform, you know.
If you can catch her, I'm sure she'd let you tie a bell to her belt.
Catching her sounds like a fool's errand.
A wise supposition. You'll be more interested in what she's brought me today anyway.
Some fine cloth, wrapped around... is that jade? Carved jade?
*ALARM*
Hold that thought.
@BATTLE
Now then... yes, Kanchou. Carved via traditional Chinese methods unless I miss my guess.
Borrowed from our honored guest?
Precisely, Kanchou.

Fields.MenuText: So it's smuggling then.
Surely raw jade would be easier to trade.
This looks worn, like it's old. Not freshly carved.

Fields.DialogueText: Seems so. It appears an officer's salary isn't enough for our friend Koku.
Depends on where the value actually lies...
Good eye, Kanchou.
While I believe Koku is smuggling raw jade, these pieces are historical artifacts.
Quite valuable to the right collectors or museum.
Damn it, I will not tolerate my ships being used as a smuggler's den.
Not to worry, Kanchou. I've already got a plan in the works.
Very well, handle it. Quickly.
Ryoukai. I promise you'll enjoy the show, Kanchou.
Not at all minister, I insist. I shall not have our hospitality for honored guests be found wanting.
Ah, Koku-san, Akagi, just in time. Do join me.
Of course, Kanchou. I must say your hospitality is so broad as to be smothering.
I'm sure Akagi will accept that in the manner it was intended, Koku-san.
Ah. About that... You are quite familiar with Akagi no Kami, are you not, Kanchou?
Far be it from me to suggest impropriety on the part of a senior officer, but others might find such casualness... upsetting.

Fields.MenuText: The Captain of a ship must be familiar with his vessel. Akagi manifesting changes nothing.
I am as familiar with Akagi as I am with my own arm, and I am certain Akagi feels the same way.
Minister, I assure you, my professional relationship with Akagi is beyond reproach.

Fields.DialogueText: Yes, the relationship between captain and ship is an intimate one historically. Many a captain's wife has called herself his mistress, as his ship is the actual spouse.
Of course, I am Kanchou's sword, when I strike, we strike as one. You would do well to remember that.
Kanchou is the very model of a naval officer. I would not have selected any lesser individual as my commanding officer.
Kami-sama, I've brought the tea and a small anko based cake I came up with.
Ah, yes, of course, my apologies.
Wonderful - thank you, Osono. Did you have any trouble with the "tea?"
None at all, Kami-sama.
*ALARM*
Seems we'll have to wait on this splendid little snack, Osono. Akagi.
At once, Kanchou.
@BATTLE
Enemy ships sighted by reconnaissance planes!
Confirm their heading and launch all planes!
@BATTLE
I'm still absolutely furious about what Koku said about us.
That we're too familiar or intimate with each other?
Yes. I'm certain he said it to irritate me and threaten you.
I'm ashamed to say he well and truly succeeded.

Fields.MenuText: I like to think we're quite professional.
Is the thought of being intimate with me so bad, Akagi?
If anything, I think we need to become yet more intimate. To know each other completely.

Fields.DialogueText: Very. Familiar, yes - but we're a highly effective team.
What? No! I didn't mean it... Ooh, you're teasing me! I'll get you, got that, Kanchou?
My! Kanchou! Careful with those words - a girl might get the wrong idea, you know.
Let's get this business with Koku done. Did Osono succeed?
Yes. We have the location of his main cache. Now we just need to stake it out.
He has a very detailed log of pending transactions. The next port visit is a big one.
Perfect. Set it up. I want him in the brig yesterday.
As you will it, Kanchou!
Are you sure about this stakeout?
I’m certain of it... we just have to wait for him to come for his stash.

Fields.MenuText: What if he figured out we're on to him?
Osono is certain she didn't get detected?
All this waiting around is killing me.

Fields.DialogueText: He'll still come for his prize if greed truly drives him. He'd never surrender his wealth.
You should know better than to ask that, Kanchou.
Patience. We're hunting, and the prey is coming soon enough...
Ah hah. There he is. Right for the bolt hole.
Master at arms! Arrest that man!
Damn, he's bolting! After him, all of you!
Akagi, can't you-
*ALARM*
Ah.
Belay that order! Battle stations! He can't get too far.
Always the worst sense of timing with these detestable creatures.
Koku? Or the Morgana?
Yes.
@BATTLE
Search the ship! If he escapes I’ll have penance from each and every one of you!
Can’t you... you know. Do the Belle thing?
I’m trying - if you’d let me focus, Kanchou! In the meantime I wanted the sailors on alert and spreading out.
Got him. Near the bow, must be going for his stash and a lifeboat. Let’s go.
*ALARM*
Damn them all! Now!? Osono! Sei bai!!
@BATTLE
As ordered, Kami-sama.
How dare you! You damned spirits, and your mongrel captain! This is an outrage! The ministry will hear of this!

Fields.MenuText: Oh, I very much hope they will, minister. They’ll also hear about your smuggling racket.
It takes a certain degree of courage to rant in your position.
If I were you, I’d be far more worried about surviving long enough to be handed over to the naval police.

Fields.DialogueText: We even have confessions from some of your accomplices.
It takes stupidity to insult me, or my kanchou, in any circumstance
He doesn’t need to worry about that. Low level trash like this isn’t worth staining Osono’s tanto.
The courts will handle your punishment, “Minister” Koku. Your fraudulent use of Imperial seals should be the subject of some discussion.
But I... you. You can’t.
We already have. Osono, escort the minister to the brig, please.
There. One piece of scum delivered to the waiting arms of the Imperial justice system.
Good. I feel like dealing with him’s taken us away from our duties too often.
Yes... I worry about that too.
*ALARM*
Kanchou, kami-sama to the bridge! Enemy attack 1000 nautical miles north!
...Malice. Damn that Koku! Let’s hurry, Kanchou!
Kanchou.
Damage report.
Malice’s squadron pulled off a flawless raid... looks like she might have scrounged support from a capital ship. Sin, perhaps.
I can’t decide if I’m primarily saddened by the loss of life, or if I want to go down to the brig and rend Koku limb from limb.
Save it for Malice.
Hai. Sumimasen. I forget myself at times.
It’s fine. Koku will get his. I hear the actual naval ministry is most eager to get their hands on him.

Fields.MenuText: So? What are we going to do about Malice?
Have we begun rescue and support operations for the port town they raided?
Apparently the Morganas even took people this time...

Fields.DialogueText: We’re going to hunt her down and bomb, torpedo, and - if we must be boring - shoot her until she sinks.
Yes, supplies are being sent out now, and a relief force is en route... they’ll probably evacuate the island entirely.
They took civilians? ...
I won't stand for this. Not anywhere, but certainly not in my own han!
Good. Our new orders are to find Malice and drive her out of the region.
With pleasure, Kanchou.
And I think you'll find that we have a few stragglers from another battle group to pick off as well.
Do we?
Give us just a few more minutes, Kanchou. You can see them with your own eyes.
@BATTLE
I'm here, Kanchou.
Good timing - let's review the operational plan.
Of course. In your wisdom and with my wise counsel, you have dictated we divide and conquer.
Today's operation therefore is not against Malice, but rather to strike her support.
We have confirmed that Sin is providing naval air power to Malice's raiders.
By driving off Sin, we will secure local air superiority, then track down Malice and gut her.

Fields.MenuText: Right, any last minute problems?
How's the operation to bait Malice away going?
I love it when a plan comes together.

Fields.DialogueText: None so far. Everything seems to be proceeding smoothly.
I have the report right here.
I feel like you need a cigar to say that properly. Shall I have Osono fetch one?
Thank you, but this probably isn't the time.
The submarine squadron we placed to catch Malice as she chased down the small bait ships...
... reports contact with the enemy. Injustice and Fire have been torpedoed on the high sea.
Safe to say Malice is distracted and Sin is vulnerable, then.
Indeed. We should be clear to proceed.
All right, time for the next act. Battle stations! All pilots to your planes. Launch the strike package!
Every man and woman, a tiger today! Show them your claws!
@BATTLE
You can't surprise me with my eyes in the sky!
Engage at once - first bomb hit on the enemy gets a double beer or sake ration.
@BATTLE
I just had a thought.
Shall we celebrate with tea? Something sweet? A banquet with the crew!
Har har. Seriously, though. When we were hunting Koku you tracked him down near instantly.
Of course. I more or less know where anyone or anything is in my hull. It's not perfect. But if I need it, I can find it.
So why not just find Koku's smuggling cache?
And ruin the fun we were having? I think not, Kanchou.

Fields.MenuText: Wait, so you could have solved this all along?
Akagi, if I find out you put yourself at needless risk...
It was a fun little mystery, wasn't it?

Fields.DialogueText: More or less.
Of course not! If I'd thought he was a pressing threat he'd have fallen overboard in a tragic accident.
Indeed, and I got to get a good gauge of your skills and abilities.
If he was really Kempeitai, as I feared, I wanted to see if there were agents aboard already.
Let Koku do all the hard counter-intelligence work for me.
Makes sense. So, any spies aboard?
Yes. But all accounted for, and none for the Kempeitai so far.
Don't worry too much about the espionage game in the fleet, Kanchou.
It's all perfectly under control.
... All right, if you say so. I trust your judgment.
Back for more, Malice? Very well! Sei bai!!
@BATTLE
Ah, that was almost refreshing. Malice can be quite clever, but there's ways to bait her.
To make her see nothing but red like a European bull - and once she's blind, she's stupid.

Fields.MenuText: What happens if Malice ever figures out what you're doing?
Clever, but careful you don't get burned playing with fire.
As long as we keep stomping her whenever she crawls out from under her rock, I don't care about the methods used.

Fields.DialogueText: Then I have some back-up plans to hold things until I find a new way to play with her.
No, Kanchou, I'm playing with Malice, not Fire... but your point is taken.
Ever the pragmatist, Kanchou, I like that in a commanding officer.
By the by, Kanchou, I was wondering if you might join me in my quarters for a drink.
I just took delivery of a Sakura tea, and I have some lovely sake if you prefer something a bit harder.
Or both - I find tea makes a lovely compliment to sake.
I don't think I've visited your quarters before - sounds like you've quite a treat for me, too.
I might have some sweets stowed away, too. I have a weakness for breads filled with anko - that is to say, red bean paste.
All right, I'm sold. Just tell me when.
Oh, you name the time, Kanchou. I'll be ready.
Thank you for joining me, Kanchou. It's not often I let anyone besides Osono into my inner sanctum.
It's beautiful here... what I can see of the room through the incense, anyway.

Fields.MenuText: As a naval officer, I couldn't ask for a better flag ship, or a better friend.
I think you're the most enthralling woman I've ever met.

Fields.DialogueText: My apologies, Kanchou. I was making offerings at the shrines of my sisters.
You have memorial shrines in your quarters? I... Oh. I see. My condolences, Akagi.
Thank you, Kanchou, but there's no need. I lost them so long ago...
Allow me to introduce you, Amagi Onee-sama, Atago, and Takao.
Don't Atago and Takao...
Live on as heavy cruisers? Yes, but they are not the Amagi class battlecruisers they were destined to be.
Still, I'm quite fond of them. Like little sisters. I also have a... Older sister. Mother perhaps? In Akagi Maru.
Maru? A merchantman?
Yes, I think quite highly of her, but she's a dedicated pacifist, and I am... not. I suspect she is somewhat disappointed in me.
I don't think anyone could be disappointed in you, Akagi.
And you, Kanchou? What do you think of Akagi?
That sounds like a toast worth drinking to!
My, did it suddenly get warmer in here? Perhaps I should open a porthole...
